extendedInfo.description: Add-On for SMS Backup & Restore - Allows the app to - Automatically upload to Google Drive. - Automatically upload to Dropbox. - Send automated emails after a backup.This app does not appear in the list of apps in the phone launcher. It is used by the SMS Backup & Restore app and gets opened from the "Backup Settings" screen of that app.Google Drive:It may not work with all devices as the Google Play Services may not be available. Please get in touch with me if you get problems.Dropbox Settings:This app only has access to its own folder and does not have access to other Dropbox folders.Check the "Use Browser for Authentication" if you want to use your default/external browser for authentication rather than the built-in functionality.Email Settings:All the settings on the screen are dependent on the Mail Service Provider that you use. The details about the service can be found on the providers site. Some of the common ones are linked at the bottom of this section.Sender Email Address: The email address from which the email should be sent.Recipient Email Address: The email address of the recipient. If you are sending the email to yourself then this will be the same as the Sender Email Address.SMTP Server: The HostName/IP Address of the email SMTP server. For example: smtp.gmail.com for Gmail.Port: The port used by the SMTP server. Normally 25/465/587. For example: 465 for Gmail.Security: The security used for connecting to the SMTP server. Use SSL/TLS for Gmail.Require Login: Checked if the SMTP server needs you to authenticate before sending emails. Check this for Gmail.User Name: The user name required to authenticate with the SMTP server. For Gmail, its your email address.Password: The password required to authenticate with the SMTP server. For Gmail, its your Gmail password. If you use 2-step authentication in Gmail, you'll need to generate an application specific password.Subject: The subject for the email.Body: The message content for the email.This App needs access to the following:* Network communication: To connect to Email/Dropbox/Google servers.* Your accounts: Used for Google Drive account setup.* View Network Connections: So that the app does not try to upload when there is no network connectivity.* Test access to Protected Storage: To read the Backup file on the SD card.

reviews.title: Works great
reviews.comment: Does what\'s it\'s meant to do. Scheduled backup runs perfectly, Dropbox integration works great, it\'s free and easy to use. Makes migrating from phone to phone easier.
reviews.author: \305\201ukasz D.

reviews.title: Feature request
reviews.comment: BUG: From time to time the Dropbox backup misses some earlier SMS-es.  Very irritating!  This app largely does what I need.  My use case involves syncing SMSes with my laptop so I only miss the following feature: upload as soon as I got an SMS.  Ideally uploading could be incremental, like one SMS per file on my Dropbox account.  That\'d result in vastly reduced processing and transfer overhead.
reviews.author: L\303\241szl\303\263 Monda

reviews.title: Simple, fast, offsite backups
reviews.comment: Simple, fast, functional. Backups can be auto sent off site to Google drive, and read on phone or  on PC. Uses XML for generic portability. Developer very responsive.
reviews.author: Chris Lerew

reviews.title: EXCELLENT
reviews.comment: Great application for backing up your text messages. Very handy. Love the e-mail functions, less stuff stored on phone.
reviews.author: Barry Smith

reviews.title: A must app for all android users...!!
reviews.comment: Whenever I do a factory reset I used to loose all my msgs.....many of dem r very imp for me. Not only me every 1 faces dis problem many times. Bt dis one app solves all our worries....! I\'ll recommend it to all my friends.....!! Thank u...!!
